entry.title: Geometric aspects of the Jacobian of a hyperplane arrangement
entry.summary: We initiate a systematic study of the interactions among algebraic structures associated to a hyperplane arrangement, namely its module of logarithmic derivations, formality (in the sense of Falk and Randell), and what we call its weak perspective representations. Our investigation is inspired by \textit{Ziegler's pair}, two line arrangements associated to the complete bipartite graph $K_{3,3}$ which, incidentally, are also known to illustrate the geometric sensitivity of infinitesimal flexibility in rigidity theory. We introduce weak perspective representations of hyperplane arrangements to elucidate these connections. We draw on the rigidity theory literature to exhibit many examples of line arrangements whose module of logarithmic derivations is sensitive not just to the intersection lattice but also to the geometry of the lines. This indicates that rigidity theory may offer a good place to look for counterexamples to a well-known conjecture of Terao. Weak perspective representations are inspired by Whiteley's parallel drawings from scene analysis. In characteristic zero we show that there is a tight connection between weak perspective representations of hyperplane arrangements and polynomials of minimal degree in certain saturations of the Jacobian of the arrangement. Our approach provides a direct link between formality and the Jacobian ideal, elucidating and extending prior work of Yuzvinsky.
